Metadata: Biotechnology reveals new routes to synthesis and structural control of silica and polysilsesquiox​anes
"The Chemistry of Organic Silicon Compounds," Volume 3, Chapter 14, Z. Rappiport and Y. Apeloig, eds., pp. 805- 819, 2001.

Recent findings of the underlying molecular mechanisms governing silica biosynthesis have led to the development of new structure-​directing catalysts and environmentally benign routes to the synthesis and structural control of silica and organosilicon-​based materials at neutral pH and low temperature. This chapter reviews recent progress and the limitations that remain in efforts to understand and harness the mechanisms governing biosilicificati​on.
